abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Sustainable
            Development of Natural Resources Project for Afghanistan is
            to assist the recipient in improving Ministry of Mines'
            capacity to effectively regulate the mineral and hydrocarbon
            resources sector in a transparent manner, and to foster
            private sector development. The closing date for the project
            will be extended from December 31, 2012 until May 31, 2013.
            The major achievements under the project to date have
            included: 1) establishing a transparent and accountable in
            tender processes, highlighted by the successful Aynak and
            Hajigak transactions which was supported at all stages by
            the International Advisory Panel (IAP); 2) supporting the
            implementation of the Extractive Industries Transparency
            Initiative (EITI) and the complementary disclosure of
            mining-generated revenues; 3) increasing oversight and
            enforcement capacity of agencies such as the Mines
            Inspectorate and the National Environmental Protection
            Agency; 4) strengthening of the Ministry of Mines (MoM)
            departments responsible for cadastre and mine title
            management; and 5) supporting archeological activities and
            cultural preservation at Mes Aynak. The extension is
            necessary to allow the project to meet select core results
            indicators prior to closing. The MoM has drafted an action
            plan to meet those objectives and complete the project. This
            will be the second extension of the project. The first
            extension was for a period of 17 months, from the original
            closing date of July 31, 2011 to the current date of
            December 31, 2012.
